sen.j: 『日本』は、明治22年（1889年）2月11日に陸羯南によって創刊された新聞である。
sen.e: The "Nippon" was a newspaper first published by Katsunan KUGA on February 11, 1889.
The "Nippon" was a newspaper first published by Katsunan KUGA on February 11, 1889.
The "Nippon" was a newspaper first published by Katsunan KUGA on February 11, 1889.

sen.j: 前年に羯南が発行した『東京電報』を前身とする。
sen.e: The "Tokyo Telegraph" that Katsunan had published the previous year was the predecessor of the Nippon.
The "Tokyo Telegraph" that Katsunan had published the previous year was the predecessor of the Nippon.
The "Tokyo Telegraph" that Katsunan had published the previous year was the predecessor of the Nippon.
Outline
Summary.
Summary.

sen.j: 特定の政党の支持や商業主義に走ることを良しとせず、国民主義の立場から時には舌鋒鋭く政府を批判した反骨の精神で知られる。
sen.e: The Nippon neglected supports from particular political parties and commercialism and was known by the spirit of defiance of sharply criticizing the government from the standpoint of the public.
The Nippon neglected supports from particular political parties and commercialism and was known by the spirit of defiance of sharply criticizing the government from the standpoint of the public.
The Nippon neglected supports from particular political parties and commercialism and was known by the spirit of defiance of sharply criticizing the government from the standpoint of the public.

sen.j: 商売を重視しなかった羯南の方針もあって部数は振るわず、存続したのは明治40年（1908年）までのわずか18年であった。
sen.e: Because of Katsunan's policy that placed little value on business, the Nippon had a small circulation and lasted only for eighteen years until 1908.
Because of Katsunan's policy that placed little value on business, the Nippon had a small circulation and lasted only for eighteen years until 1908.
Because of Katsunan's policy that placed little value on business, the Nippon had a small circulation and lasted only for eighteen years until 1908.

sen.j: とはいえ『日本』には主筆の羯南以下、正岡子規など明治を代表する多くの文人が集い、後世の文壇に与えた影響は大きい。
sen.e: However, in the "Nippon" many representative writers in the Meiji period such as Katsunan, the editor, and MASAOKA Shiki gathered and they greatly influenced the following literary world.
However, in the "Nippon" many representative writers in the Meiji period such as Katsunan, the editor, and Shiki MASAOKA gathered and they greatly influenced the following literary world.
However, in the "Nippon" many representative writers in the Meiji period such as Katsunan, the editor, and Shiki MASAOKA gathered and they greatly influenced the following literary world.

sen.j: 正岡子規が外来の野球用語を日本語に訳したのもこの新聞においてであった。
sen.e: It was in this newspaper that MASAOKA Shiki translated foreign baseball terms into Japanese.
It was in this newspaper that MASAOKA Shiki translated foreign baseball terms into Japanese.
It was in this newspaper that MASAOKA Shiki translated foreign baseball terms into Japanese.
